Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Epsilon Aurigae is an F-type main sequence star with a mass of 1.8 M☉ and radius 2 R☉, located at about 40 light-years away in the constellation Auriga.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has become known for many years to be surrounded by dusty material that obscures its visible spectrum.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The infrared excess emission detected around this object suggests it may have a circumstellar disk similar to those found around young stars such as T Tauri or Herbig Ae/Be stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, there are indications that the system contains a close companion which could also contribute to the observed infrared excess emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new photometric observations obtained using the United Kingdom Infrared Telescope (UKIRT) on Mauna Kea over the period 1997-2001 covering wavelengths between 0.9-2.5 microns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These data show significant variations of both the near-infrared fluxes and colours of the central source consistent with changes in the amount of dust surrounding the star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behaviour is very similar to what is seen in other pre-main-sequence systems where accretion onto the central star causes periodic increases in luminosity accompanied by increased levels of reddening due to heating of the surrounding dust grains.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that the current level of activity in the system is relatively low compared to previous epochs but we cannot rule out the possibility that the recent increase in brightness was caused by a short-lived burst of enhanced accretion rather than steady-state accretion occurring throughout our observing campaign.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new near-infrared (NIR) polarimetric observations of the GG Tau system, which reveal that its circumstellar disk is highly structured and contains several bright regions with different polarization properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most prominent feature in our data set is an arc-like structure located at about 0.5 arcsec to the south-east of the central binary star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This region shows strong polarized emission up to 10% of the total intensity and has was previously identified as a reflection nebula by Weintraub et al. (1993) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this feature can be explained by scattering off optically thin dust grains close to the midplane of the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we detect two other bright features on either side of the central binary.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These are also associated with high degrees of linear polarization but show no clear evidence for scattered light.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Instead they appear to be caused by absorption against the background stellar flux.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we identify three additional fainter structures in the southern part of the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All these features have similar polarization angles indicating that their origin may be related.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on the fluidization of a thin, horizontally vibrating granular bed by vertical oscillations at low frequency and amplitude.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The system was studied experimentally using high-speed video imaging in combination with particle tracking velocimetry (PTV).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for sufficiently large vibration amplitudes, particles are ejected from the surface into the air as they reach their maximum height during an upward motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads to the formation of a dilute gas phase above the dense packing near the bottom of the container.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we observe convection rolls which transport grains across the entire depth of the bed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results show striking similarities to those observed in vibrated beds of sand or glass beads but differ significantly from previous studies performed on systems where only horizontal vibrations are applied.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Vibrations can induce transitions between different states of matter such as solids, liquids, and gases [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it has been shown that a solid state may become unstable when subjected to periodic forcing [2] , resulting in the spontaneous generation of traveling waves [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A particularly interesting case occurs if both horizontal and vertical components of the driving force act simultaneously [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With this work we study the response of a thin granular layer to simultaneous application of horizontal and vertical vibrations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experiments reveal new phenomena not seen before with other types of driven granular media.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new near-infrared photometric data from the Pleiades open cluster obtained with the Infrared Survey Facility (IRSF) on the South African Astronomical Observatory's 1-m telescope at Sutherland in November 2005.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observations are made using the IRSF/SIRIUS camera which has simultaneous JHK s imaging capability over an 8 x8 field-of-view.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We had also used archival 2MASS data to supplement our sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results are presented as colour-magnitude diagrams (CMDs), where we show that there is good agreement between our photometry and previous studies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using these CMDs, we identify several previously unreported candidate members for the Pleiades based upon their location relative to theoretical pre-main sequence evolutionary tracks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These candidates include two objects located at the substellar boundary, one of which appears to be a brown dwarf member of the Pleiades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report on radio observations made with the Australia Telescope Compact Array (ATCA) at 5 GHz and 8.6 GHz, which reveal an unresolved point source coincident with G1, one of the most massive globular clusters known to exist in our Galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed flux density is consistent with that expected for a black hole accreting at the Eddington limit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present new optical spectroscopy obtained using the Gemini Multi-Object Spectrographs (GMOS), which shows no evidence of emission lines associated with gas surrounding the central object.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are inconsistent with previous claims that this cluster contains a supermassive black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If confirmed by future studies, these findings would represent the first detection of an intermediate mass black hole in any galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discovery has important implications for understanding how such objects form and evolve over cosmic time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it will provide insight into the formation history of the Milky Way itself.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The authors acknowledge support from NASA through Chandra Award Number GO0-1111B issued by the Chandra X-ray Observatory Center, which was operated by the Smithsonian Astrophysical Observatory for and on behalf of NASA under contract NAS8-03060.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We introduce the notion of ``abstract factorials'', which are functions that can be used to represent and manipulate sets of integers in an efficient manner.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these functions can be implemented using standard data structures such as hash tables or trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we present several applications of this new class of objects including fast algorithms for computing the number of integer partitions with bounded parts (the so-called ``Stirling numbers of the second kind'') and for counting the number of ways to tile a rectangular board with tiles of different sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The concept of abstract factorials was introduced along with its implementation on top of existing data structures like hash tables or binary search trees.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Several applications are presented, among them fast algorithms for computing Stirling numbers of the second type and tiling problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work was supported by NSF grant CCF-0634420.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 1 Introduction In many computational settings it is necessary to perform operations over large collections of integers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, one may need to count the number of ways to partition a set into subsets of equal size, or to compute the number of tilings of a rectangular board with tiles having different shapes and sizes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These computations often require repeated evaluation of arithmetic expressions involving sums and products of integers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown recently that certain classes of such expressions admit very efficient representations based on combinatorial objects known as ``factorials''

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A factorial is essentially a function that maps each positive integer n to another object f(n), called the ``value'' of the factorial at n. Such values can satisfy two properties:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, they should form a sequence of nonnegative integers whose sum grows exponentially; i.e., there exists some constant c > 0 so that the value of any factorial satisfies |f(n)| <= cn^c for all sufficiently large n. Second, the values of distinct factorials cannot collide too frequently; more precisely, if f(n1) = f(n2) then n1 and n2 must differ by at least a fixed amount d.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Globular clusters are dense stellar systems that contain thousands to millions of stars, and can be the oldest gravitationally bound objects known.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The discovery of planets around other stars has raised questions about whether or not globular cluster members can also harbor planetary systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we use Monte Carlo simulations to examine how many planets could exist within globular clusters with different masses and ages.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for most reasonable assumptions on planet formation rates, there should be at least one planet per star in all but the youngest (<10 Myr) and lowest mass (<100 Msun) clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result is robust against uncertainties in our knowledge of planet formation efficiencies and initial conditions such as the number density distribution of planetesimals.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that it will be possible to detect planets orbiting globular cluster members using current observational techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Planetary systems; Stellar evolution; Star clusters; Formation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The work function is one among the most important parameters in semiconductor devices, and its accurate measurement is essential for device design and performance prediction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this article we review some recent progresses in the determination of the work functions of various materials by using ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy (UPS) with synchrotron radiation as well as other techniques such as scanning tunneling microscopy/spectroscopy (STM/STS), inverse photoemission spectroscopy (IPES), and Kelvin probe force microscopy (KPFM).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss how to determine the absolute values of the work functions of different semiconductors based on UPS measurements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present our perspectives on future research directions in this field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The work function is an important parameter in semiconductor devices, which determines their electrical properties including carrier transport behavior and Schottky barrier height

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Accurate measurement of the work function is therefore crucial for both fundamental understanding of electronic structure and practical applications

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article, we will first briefly introduce several experimental methods used to measure the work function of various materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then we will show that these results can get compared directly if they are obtained under similar conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Afterwards, we can demonstrate how to determine the absolute value of the work function of different semiconductors through ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy (UPES) experiments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we can give out our perspective on future research direction in this area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Experimental Methods  Ultraviolet Photoelectron Spectroscopy (UPS) Ultraviolet photoelectron spectroscopy has been widely applied to study the surface electronic structures of many kinds of materials [3] , especially those with low electron binding energies [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It measures the kinetic energy distribution of electrons emitted from a sample when it is illuminated by monochromatic light at a specific photon energy hν

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By measuring the kinetic energy Ekin of photoelectrons emitted from the Fermi level EF into vacuum [6] , the work function Φ is then be determined according to the following equation:  where e is the elementary charge and m* is the effective mass of the photoelectrons

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, Figure 1 shows

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the first direct determination for the stellar radius in an interacting binary system, using interferometric observations obtained with the VLTI and AMBER instrument.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We resolve for the first time the components of the close binary system SS Leporis (separation ~0.3 arcsec), which consists of two main sequence stars that were both filling their respective Roche lobes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By fitting theoretical models to our data we find that one component is slightly larger than expected by theory while the other has a radius consistent with predictions based on evolutionary tracks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that tidal interactions have modified the radii of these stars during their evolution towards contact.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results also show that the orbital inclination angle i = 60 ± 5 degrees, as determined previously through radial velocity measurements, agrees well with our new estimate derived directly from the observed separation between the two stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Interferometry; Binary Stars; Stellar Radius

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of an optical monitoring campaign on two luminous quasars at redshifts z = 1.7 and 2.1 with the aim to study their long-term line and continuum variability properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observations was carried out in the period between September 2005 and December 2007 using the Nordic Optical Telescope (NOT) equipped with ALFOSC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that both objects show significant variations over time scales ranging from months up to years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we detect strong changes in the Hβ emission-line profiles which are accompanied by corresponding flux density fluctuations in the adjacent continuum regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that the observed spectral changes can be explained as being due to variable obscuration effects caused by clouds moving across our line-of-sight towards the central engine.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This scenario was supported by the fact that the detected variabilities appear to occur simultaneously for all three Balmer lines studied here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we find evidence of additional short-term variability events occurring within individual nights.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new infrared (IR) photometry of the galaxy cluster MS1054-03 at z = 0.83, obtained with ISOCAM on board ISO.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data was used to study star formation activity within this rich cluster environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the IR luminosity function was well fitted by a Schechter function with L* ~ 1 x 1012L⊙ and α ~ -1.7 over the range 8-1000 µm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that there may be an excess number of faint galaxies compared to local clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we detect several bright sources which have become identified as AGN candidates based upon their mid-IR colours.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These objects appear to lie preferentially near the centre of the cluster suggesting they could be triggered by interactions between galaxies or mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we use our results together with published optical spectroscopy to investigate how the properties of individual galaxies evolve through time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analytic model for the evolution of the 21 cm brightness temperature fluctuations during cosmic reionization, based on correlated random walks (CRWs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that CRW models can reproduce many features observed in numerical simulations of reionization, including the power spectrum at large scales, as well as the characteristic shape of the cross-correlation between different redshifts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to these results, we find that our model predicts a new feature which is not seen in previous work -the presence of large-scale correlations even after reionization has completed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect may be detectable with future radio telescopes such as SKA.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The 21cm line emission from neutral hydrogen provides us with a unique probe into the early universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It allows one to study the process of reionization when most of the matter was still dark and cold gas clouds were surrounded by ionized bubbles [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this signal is extremely weak compared to other foregrounds produced by astrophysical sources [2] , so it will take several years before we are able to detect it directly [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to make predictions about what kind of signals we should expect to see once observations become possible, theoretical studies have be performed using both semi-analytic [4] and fully numerical methods [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These works have shown that there exist two main types of signatures associated with reionization

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] : 1) the global signature of the average ionization fraction; 2) the local signature of individual HII regions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although the first type of signal is relatively easy to measure [7, 8] , the second type requires more advanced techniques [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results from an optical imaging survey with Subaru/Suprime-Cam of the nearby galaxy group centered on M31, including its brightest satellite galaxy, Andromeda II (M32).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use this data to study the internal structure and stellar populations of Andromeda II in detail for the first time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The surface brightness profile shows that Andromeda II is well described by two exponential components separated at about 1 kpc along the major axis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This double-exponential shape suggests that Andromeda II consists of two distinct components; one component has a younger age than the other.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using SSP models we find that these two components have ages of 2 Gyr and 10 Gyr respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, there are several small knots distributed over the entire body of Andromeda II which may be associated with recent star formation activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These knots show no clear correlation between their locations and those of globular clusters or HII regions found previously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new photometry from the globular cluster NGC 1904, obtained with the Wide Field Camera 3 (WFC3) on board HST in four filters spanning the optical and near-infrared wavelength range.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this cluster has an extended blue horizontal branch (BHB), which is populated by both hot BHBs and blue stragglers (BSs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to study these populations separately we use two different methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we select stars based on their location along the red giant branch (RGB); secondly, we perform artificial star tests using our best-fit model CMD as input.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Both approaches yield consistent results.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our analysis shows that the fraction of BSs among all evolved stars amounts to f = 0.11 ± 0.01.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value agrees well to previous studies of other clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using theoretical models we estimate the age of the cluster at t = 12 Gyr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the effect of nonhomogeneity on the magnetic properties of hybrid structures consisting of a ferromagnet (FM) and a type-II superconductor (SC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, depending on the FM thickness dF M , there are two different regimes for the SC critical temperature

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Tc: i)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For small values of dF M Tc is suppressed by the proximity effect; ii) for large values of dF M we find an enhancement of Tc due to the exchange field induced by the FM layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter regime can be understood as a consequence of the competition between the Zeeman energy and the condensation energy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For addition, we discuss how these results depend on the relative orientation of the FM magnetization with respect to the applied external magnetic field Hext.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction     Superconducting materials have become widely studied over many years because they exhibit macroscopic quantum phenomena such as zero resistance at low temperatures [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, it had become possible to fabricate hybrid structures combining conventional metals or semiconductors with unconventional ones like high-temperature superconductors [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These systems offer new possibilities for studying fundamental physical effects

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work we consider a system composed of a thin film of a type-II superconductor deposited onto a ferromagnetic material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This kind of structure was first proposed theoretically by Buzdin et al.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] who showed that the presence of a ferromagnetic layer could lead to interesting effects on the superconducting state.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They found that when the ferromagnetic layer is thinner than its coherence length ξF M = D/2πTc

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] , where D is a diffusion coefficient, the proximity effect suppresses the critical temperature Tc [7–9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, if the ferromagnetic layer is thick enough so that the exchange interaction becomes important, then the critical temperature increases [10, 11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It should also been noted that the behavior of the critical temperature depends strongly on the direction of the magnetization vector mF M of the ferromagnetic layer

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If mF M lies parallel to the surface normal n, the critical temperature decreases monotonically with

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study spin effects on the lattice QCD using recurrence lattices (RL) with multi-site exchanges, which are constructed by applying the RL transformation to the original fermion action.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the spin dependence becomes suppressed for large quark masses but not completely removed even at mq

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 = 5 GeV. The residual spin dependence can be reduced further if we use larger number of sites in the exchange term.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For this work, we adopt Ns = 4 as an example.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also find that the spin dependent part of the effective potential has no imaginary part up to O(a^4).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This implies that there exists no spontaneous breaking of chiral symmetry due to spin effects within our framework.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible extensions of our method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 PACS numbers: 11.15.Ha, 12.38.Gc, 13 .25.Hw  I. INTRODUCTORY REMARK In recent years, it was found that the standard Wilson-type fermions suffer from severe problems such as the so-called species doubling problem

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , the Nielsen-Ninomiya theorem [2] , and the Gribov copy problem

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These difficulties have been overcome by introducing new types of fermionic actions [4] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most popular one among them is probably the overlap-Dirac operator

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [9] , whose eigenfunctions satisfy the Ginsparg-Wilson relation [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, its numerical cost grows rapidly when the lattice volume becomes large because the inverse of the Dirac operator must be calculated exactly.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To reduce the computational costs, several approximate methods are proposed [11] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In these approaches, the Neuberger overlap operator

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14] seems to be the best choice so far [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another promising approach is based on the idea of the exact renormalization group [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown [17] that the fermion determinant detD(μ), where D(μ) denotes the fermion matrix defined through the fermion action Sf

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [U] ≡ ∑x Tr[γμD(μ)Ux], satisfies a following flow equation:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The variation of the values of physical constants is one of the most important problems for modern physics, cosmology and astrophysics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal in this work was to study the possible time variations in some fundamental constants (fine structure constant α, gravitational constant G, proton-to-electron mass ratio μ) using different theoretical approaches as well as observational data on distant objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our previous works we have shown that the observed redshifts of quasars can be explained by varying fine-structure constant with cosmic time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also found that the evolution of the universe may lead to the change of other fundamental constants such as gravitational constant or proton-to-electron mass ratio.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we present new results obtained in the framework of these models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we show how the model based on varying fine-structure constant explains the recent measurements of quasar absorption lines at high redshift performed by Webb et al. (1999) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Second, we discuss the possibility of explaining the Hubble parameter H0 = 72 ± 8 km s-1 Mpc-1 measured recently by Freedman et al. (2001) using the same approach.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we consider another class of models where all three fundamental constants vary simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new constraints on warm dark matter (WDM) models by combining the results of two recent surveys for gravitationally lensed quasars, SDSS and CFHTLS Wide.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the observed number density of lenses is consistent with predictions based on cold dark matter simulations but inconsistent at more than 3 sigma confidence level if we assume a standard thermal relic WDM model with mass mX = 1 keV. This result suggests either that the current WDM scenario needs to been modified or that there are other systematic effects which have not been taken into account in our analysis.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The full text can been found at: http://arxiv.org/abs/astro-ph/0604070v1.pdf .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The existence of dark matter has now become established beyond reasonable doubt through its gravitational influence on visible matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite decades of research, little else about this mysterious substance is known.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it remains unclear if dark matter consists of one particle species only - as assumed in most theoretical studies -or whether it comprises several different particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One possibility is that dark matter consists of weakly interacting massive particles (WIMPs), such as neutralinos predicted within supersymmetric extensions of the Standard Model

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On order to test these scenarios observationally, astronomers look for signatures of dark matter in astrophysical objects like galaxies [2] , clusters [3] and quasars [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A particularly promising method involves searching for gravitationally lensed systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] where light rays emitted from distant sources bend around intervening dark matter halos

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since dark matter consists of WIMPs then their masses should lie between 10 GeV/c 2 and 100 TeV/c 2

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, the recently discovered galaxy cluster Abell 2218 [9] could contain a halo made up entirely of WIMPs [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the spectroscopic follow-up observations from eight galaxy clusters at redshifts z=0.6-0.9 selected in the Red-Sequence Cluster Survey (RCS).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The sample was composed by four X-ray luminous and four optically rich clusters, with masses ranging between M500 = 1.5 × 1014 - 2.7 × 1014 h70M⊙ .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have obtained spectra for more than 100 cluster members using VLT/FORS2 and Keck/DEIMOS spectrographs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From these data we derive velocity dispersions, dynamical mass estimates, and luminosity-weighted ages for each system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For addition to this analysis, we also study the evolution of the scaling relations as a function of redshift up to z=1.1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the observed properties are consistent with those expected for massive systems undergoing gravitational collapse.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there seems to be an offset towards lower values of σv /σ⋆ compared to predictions based on numerical simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of observations made by the Multiband Imaging Photometer for Spitzer (MIPS) in 24 and 70 micron bands toward the Serpens cloud core.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data was obtained as part of the Spitzer Space Telescope's "Cores to Disks" Legacy program (c2d).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have detected more than 100 infrared sources within an area of 0.5 square degrees centered on the Serpens South region.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Most of these are associated with young stellar objects that show signs of ongoing star formation activity such as outflows or disks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A few dozen sources appear to be background galaxies at redshifts between 1.2 and 3.6.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we report the detection of two previously unknown protostars embedded in dense cores located near the center of the Serpens South filamentary structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These new detections increase our knowledge about the physical conditions prevailing inside this active star-forming complex.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spiral wave is an important pattern observed in many natural systems, such as chemical reactions and biological populations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Through this study we investigate how spiral waves evolve into spatiotemporal chaotic patterns through their interactions with each other using a simple model for plankton population dynamics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that when two or more spiral waves collide they can either annihilate themselves or form new spirals depending on initial conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The newly formed spirals may also interact with existing ones to produce complex spatiotemporal structures including labyrinthine patterns.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that spiral waves are not necessarily stable but could be unstable under certain circumstances.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Spiral waves have been found in various physical, chemical and biological systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They play crucial roles in determining the dynamical behaviors of these systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , e.g., in cardiac tissue [3] , BZ reaction [4] , semiconductor lasers

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] , and plankton ecosystems [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been growing interest in studying the formation and evolution of spiral waves

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It is shown that spiral waves can undergo different types of instabilities [9] which lead to complicated spatiotemporal patterns [10] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, it is reported that spiral waves can become unstable due to collisions between them [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This instability leads in the birth of new spiral waves

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These newborn spirals then interact with one another resulting in the formation of complex spatiotempual structures [13] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most previous studies focused only on local interactions among spiral waves

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14, 15] while ignoring possible effects caused by distant interactions

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report the detection of faint emission line wings in the H

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I 21 cm absorption spectrum toward PKS 1413+135, which was blueshifted by up to -500 km s-1 and redshifted by up to +300 km s-1 with respect to the systemic velocity (v = 0).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The observed widths for these wings correspond to temperatures T ~ 10 4 K for an assumed Doppler parameter b = 20 km s-1 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We argue whether this is evidence for infalling gas onto the central black hole.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This interpretation was supported by recent observations of broad optical lines in quasars showing similar forbidden-velocity wing structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find tentative evidence for outflowing material on larger scales as indicated by weak red-shifted emission features between v = 300 and 600 km s-1 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The data was obtained using the Westerbork Synthesis Radio Telescope during several observing runs in 1997-1998.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report upon the detection by high-precision radial-velocity measurements with the HARPS spectrograph of an extrasolar planet orbiting the nearby (d = 8.3 pc) M3V star GJ 674, which is part of our ongoing survey to find low-mass companions in short-period orbits using this instrument.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The new planet has a minimum mass of Mp = 1.1 MJup and a period P = 3.6 days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was found through a combination of two independent methods: the analysis of the bisector span of cross-correlation functions and that of the full-width at half-maximum of these same functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also present evidence suggesting that there may be another companion in a wider orbit.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This would make it one of only three known systems hosting more than one transiting exoplanet.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Extrasolar planet - Radial velocity - Nearby stars

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the mid-infrared (MIR) spectrum from the central region in the Virgo galaxy cluster, obtained with Spitzer/IRS at high spatial resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The MIR emission is dominated by polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon features and silicate absorption bands that are spatially extended over several kpc scales along the minor axis of the galaxy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find evidence of an additional component to this emission which peaks on top of the nucleus within 0.5 arcsec (0.1 pc).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This nuclear source has been previously detected as a compact radio core and near-infrared continuum source but not seen before in the infrared spectral domain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It shows strong PAH emission lines with weak fine-structure line emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 For example, if we have a device which measures the temperature of water at room temperature T = 20 °C , then we should like to obtain values close to 20 ± 0.1°C when repeating the measurement many times [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 With this thesis we study distributed algorithms for spectrum allocation, power control, routing, and congestion control problems in wireless networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We first consider the problem for joint channel assignment and power control (JCAPC) with minimum total transmit power consumption subject to quality-of-service constraints on each link.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The JCAPC problem was formulated as an integer program which can be solved by using standard linear programming techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, such centralized solutions are not practical due to their high computational complexity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to overcome these difficulties, we propose two distributed algorithms based on dual decomposition methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our simulation results show that our proposed algorithms perform close to optimality while requiring only local information exchange among neighboring nodes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we investigate the problem for joint routing and congestion control (JRCC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem arises when there exists multiple paths between source-destination pairs in a network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each path has different available bandwidths depending on its physical characteristics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To achieve fairness across all flows sharing common links, JRCC requires that the rate allocated to any flow should depend on both the current load along the path it uses and the number of competing flows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We formulate the JRCC problem as a convex optimization problem whose objective function is to maximize the aggregate utility over all users under certain capacity constraints at each node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, we develop a distributed algorithm based on primal decomposition method to solve the JRCC problem.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present some numerical examples to demonstrate the performance for our proposed algorithm.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analysis of the UKIRT Infrared Deep Sky Survey (UKIDSS) Galactic Cluster Survey data for the open cluster, Pleiades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use this to derive the number ratio between binaries and single stars in the range 0.1 < M/M⊙ < 1.0 as well as the initial mass function (IMF).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are compared against previous studies using different techniques.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our derived binary fraction is consistent within uncertainties with that found by other authors but our IMF shows significant differences when compared to previous work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These discrepancies may be due to contamination from background galaxies or unresolved multiple systems which have been included in previous analyses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This study highlights the importance for accurate photometry over large areas combined with high resolution spectroscopy to fully understand the properties of young open clusters such as the Pleiades.

 Keywords: Open cluster; Binary star systems; Initial Mass Function; Substellar object

 We present new exact half-BPS solutions to the low-energy effective action for type-IIB string theory in ten dimensions, which is supported by fluxes on an arbitrary number of intersecting D3-branes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These solutions can be viewed as generalizations of the single Janus solution presented in [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also discuss some properties of these solutions that are not discussed previously.

 We present the theory of macroscopic quantum tunneling (MQT) in high-temperature superconductors with an emphasis on its application to c-axis junctions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that MQT are suppressed by thermal fluctuations and magnetic field, but can be enhanced by applying a bias current or increasing the junction area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are compared with experiments performed at 4 K and 77 K. In particular we find good agreement between our theoretical predictions and experimental data obtained recently on YBa2Cu3O7-x single crystals.

 Introduction     Superconductivity was discovered more than half a century ago

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since then many new materials have be found which exhibit this fascinating phenomenon [2] , including some with very high transition temperatures T_c

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, despite intensive research efforts there still remain several open questions about the nature of these novel compounds [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One such question concerns the mechanism responsible for their unusual properties [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been suggested [6] that the pairing interaction may involve phonons

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [7 - 8] as well as spin excitations [10 - 12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads into two possible scenarios for the formation of Cooper pairs [13] : either they form directly out of electrons via electron-phonon interactions [14] , or indirectly through spin-fluctuations [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These different mechanisms lead to distinct physical pictures [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if one assumes that the pairing occurs only due to electron-phonon interactions

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [17] , it follows that the gap function should vanish along certain lines in momentum space

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, if one considers the possibility of pair formation mediated by spin fluctuations [19] , the gap function vanishes over all momenta [20] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most important feature of both types of models is that they predict the existence of nodes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [21] in the energy spectrum [22] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Nodes occur when the order parameter changes sign in the Fermi surface [23] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They were first predicted theoretically

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [24 - 25] was later observed experimentally

 We present an efficient distributed algorithm for implementing the most common query operations in relational databases, namely selection and projection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed approach was based on the concept of data partitioning which allows us to distribute the workload among different nodes in order to minimize communication costs between them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our method can become used as a building block for more complex queries such as joins or aggregates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we provide experimental results showing how our solution outperforms existing approaches in orders of magnitude when dealing with large datasets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Relational database management systems (RDBMS) are widely used nowadays due to their ability to store and manage huge amounts of information efficiently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this efficiency comes at the cost of high computational complexity since all the data has to reside in main memory during processing time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This problem becomes even worse if one wants to perform ad-hoc analysis over very large volumes of data stored in RDBMSs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In fact, it may take hours or days just to answer simple questions like "Which customers bought product X?" or "What products were sold together last year?".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To overcome these limitations, several research efforts have been made recently towards developing new techniques allowing users to access and analyze massive amounts of data without having to load everything into main memory simultaneously.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These solutions usually rely on parallel computing frameworks where each node stores only part of the whole dataset while performing local computations independently from other nodes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The background radiation in space is dominated by cosmic rays and their secondary products, such as neutrons and gamma-rays.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The most important source of these particles are galactic supernovae which occur at an average rate of one per century.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present results on the background radiation expected to be measured with the pn-CCDs (p-type silicon charge-coupled devices) that will be used in the CERN Axion Solar telescope (CAST).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have simulated the response of CAST's detectors using GEANT4 Monte Carlo simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These were then combined with models of the particle fluxes in space to predict the background count rates observed by the cameras.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our predictions show that the background count rate due to cosmic ray interactions should not exceed 0.1 counts s-1 pixel-1 over the entire field-of-view of each camera.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This corresponds with less than 1% of the signal expected from axions produced in the Sun's magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present results on the volume operator in loop quantum gravity (LQG).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The volume operator is an important ingredient for many physical applications, such as black hole entropy and cosmological perturbations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that it can be written as a sum over spin network states with coefficients which are determined by the geometry of the underlying graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find that the spectrum of this operator agrees exactly with the one obtained using group field theory methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This provides further evidence of the equivalence between LQG and group field theory at the level of operators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how to use these results to compute expectation values for the volume operator in semiclassical states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results will appear elsewhere.

 The hot intergalactic medium (IGM) is an important component in our understanding of galaxy formation, as it provides the fuel for star formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The IGM consists primarily of ionized hydrogen gas at temperatures between 10^6 K to 10^7 K with densities ranging from 1 atom/cm^3 to 100 atoms /cm^3.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk we will discuss how observations of the Lyman-alpha forest can be used to probe the physical properties of the IGM on large scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We will also present results from recent work using data obtained by the Sloan Digital Sky Survey that show evidence for large-scale fluctuations in the temperature-density relation of the IGM.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we will describe some current efforts aimed at measuring the thermal history of the universe through measurements of the kinetic SZ effect produced by clusters of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This research was supported by NASA grant NAG5-13286.

 We present the results from subjective evaluation experiments conducted on forms designed for use within immersive environments, such as virtual reality (VR) and augmented reality (AR).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The goal is to investigate how users perceive different form designs when immersed in these environments.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We compare three designs: traditional 2D forms, 3D forms that are rendered using perspective projection, and 3D forms that are rendered with orthographic projection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our findings show that there were no significant differences between the two types of 3D forms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, both 3D forms received significantly higher ratings over their 2D counterparts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that 3D forms can become used effectively in immersive environments without requiring special rendering techniques or additional hardware.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we found that participants preferred forms that had more visual cues indicating depth information over those that did not have any such cues.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our study also shows that it may be possible to create effective forms by combining elements from multiple existing designs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose an image stabilizing method for video capturing in turbulent environments, which is based on the super-resolution technique.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method can be used to improve the quality of captured videos with handheld cameras or other devices that are subject to motion blur caused by turbulence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We first estimate the camera motion using optical flow between consecutive frames.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then we use this information as input data into our super-resolution algorithm to generate high resolution images.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, these images are combined together to produce a stable output frame.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental results show that the proposed method outperforms existing methods both visually and quantitatively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Real time video processing; Turbulence; Motion blur; Optical flow; Super-resolution; Image stabilization.

 Introduction     In recent years there has been growing interest in developing techniques for real time video processing applications such as video surveillance systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , traffic monitoring [2] , remote sensing [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most of these applications require capturing clear images under challenging conditions like low-light illumination [4] , fast moving objects

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [5] , blurry scenes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Among all these challenges, one of the major problems is how to deal with the motion blur caused by turbulence [7][8][9] when capturing videos with hand-held cameras or other devices [10] .

 We present new measurements of the mean and scatter in the velocity dispersion-optical richness relation (VRR) for galaxy clusters selected by their red-sequence galaxies using data from the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 7 (SDSS DR7).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use two different methods to measure cluster velocities, one based on spectroscopic observations from member galaxies and another that uses photometric redshift estimates of all galaxies within a fixed aperture centered on each cluster's brightest cluster galaxy (BGG).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results are consistent with previous studies at low-redshift but show significant differences when compared to recent work done at higher redshifts.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The discrepancies between our results and those presented in earlier works may be due to systematic effects associated with the measurement techniques used or could indicate evolution in the VRR over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For either case, these results highlight the need for further investigation into this relationship as well as other scaling relations involving galaxy clusters.

 We present an overview on recent progress in the development and application of techniques to cool molecules by exploiting their interaction with optical cavities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss how these methods can be used to prepare samples of cold, trapped molecules that are suitable for precision measurements or quantum information processing applications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we focus on two different approaches which have been developed recently at our laboratory: (i)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The use of electromagnetically induced transparency (EIT), combined with stimulated Raman adiabatic passage (STIRAP), to produce large numbers of optically trapped ground-state polar molecules.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (ii) Cavity-enhanced photoassociation spectroscopy as a tool to study ultracold collisions between alkali-metal atoms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we briefly outline some possible future directions of this research area.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Molecules offer many advantages over atomic systems when it comes to implementing novel quantum technologies such as high-precision metrology [1] , quantum simulation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , and quantum networks [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most molecular species cannot been directly cooled using conventional laser cooling schemes because they lack closed cycling transitions [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to overcome this problem several alternative cooling strategies have been proposed [5] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One promising approach is based on the combination of electromagnetically-induced transparency (EIT)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [9] and stimulated Raman adiabatic passages (STIRAP)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This method has been successfully applied to create dense ensembles of ground state polar molecules

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another possibility consists in trapping molecules via photoassociative processes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here one exploits the fact that the spontaneous emission rate into bound states increases exponentially with decreasing temperature [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After coupling the excited molecular levels to high-finesse optical cavities [18] - [20] , the resulting increase in radiative lifetime leads to efficient trapping [21] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These techniques allow us to trap up to 10 5 molecules at cm 3 inside a single-mode optical resonator

 We have carried out an extensive search for periodicities in the light curves of all known spectroscopic binary systems with components classified as A-type stars (AAB, AAO, AB) by using the phase dispersion minimization method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We found that two of these systems are indeed double-mode Cepheids, while another one is probably a single-mode Cepheid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These remaining three systems show no significant periodicity at all.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this we report on the discovery of a new multiperiodic Delta-Scuti variable which shows several frequencies between 0.5 and 1 d-1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The HST data reveal that this object was surrounded by a bright ring-like structure extending to ~0.5′′ (~120 AU).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find evidence for two spiral arms emerging from the inner part of the ring toward its center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have performed detailed non-radial stellar oscillation calculations using state-of-the-art evolutionary models that include overshooting at convective boundaries as well as microscopic diffusion processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal is to investigate how the observed frequency pattern changes during evolution due to the effects of rotation-induced mixing and chemical composition gradients.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we focus our attention on the so-called mixed modes which are trapped in the region where the hydrogen burning shell overlaps with the helium core.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These modes show very characteristic features such as large amplitudes and high degree of nonlinearity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that these modes can be excited by turbulent pressure fluctuations associated with the convection zone located near the surface layers of the star.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, they also suggest that the excitation mechanism may change significantly when the star evolves off the ZAMS towards higher luminosities.

 We report the discovery of two low-luminosity quasars (LLQs) with redshifts ~4 in the Sloan Digital Sky Survey Data Release 7 quasar catalog.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The LLQs are spectroscopically peculiar and have very weak emission lines compared to typical quasars at similar redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that their optical-to-infrared spectral energy distributions can be well-fitted by an accretion disk model with extremely high black hole masses (M BH >10 10 M sun ) and Eddington ratios (L/L edd >0.1).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that these objects may represent a new class of supermassive black holes which grow rapidly through gas-rich mergers or interactions during early cosmic epochs.

 The amplitude of these fluctuations decreases exponentially as time increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition of this exponential decay we observe an algebraic tail at large times.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This algebraic tail can be explained by the presence of small islands inside the chaotic sea.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results are confirmed numerically using different methods.

 We present an overview on our recent work on vector meson production in heavy ion collisions at RHIC and LHC energies, based on holographic QCD models with chiral symmetry breaking (AdS/QCD).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We discuss how these models can be used to calculate hadronic observables such as transverse momentum spectra and elliptic flow coefficients for light quarks and gluons produced in nuclear reactions.

 We find that the observed X-ray light curve can be reproduced by assuming an initial mass loss rate of ~10-6 Msun/yr for the red giant component, which is consistent with theoretical predictions.

 The predicted temperature structure of the shocked region agrees well with the observationally inferred one.

 The detection of exoplanets have been one of the most exciting recent developments in astronomy, but their characterization is still incomplete.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The goal of this thesis was to develop new techniques for characterizing exoplanetary systems using dynamical methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, I studied how planets can become used as probes into the formation history of planetary systems by measuring the mass distribution of small bodies (planetesimals) that are trapped in mean motion resonances with them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 My first project investigated the effect of planetesimal size on the stability of planetary orbits.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using numerical simulations, we found that smaller planetesimals tend to destabilize planetary orbits more quickly than larger ones because they have higher orbital eccentricities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that there may exist an upper limit to the size of planetesimals that form during planet migration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 My second project examined the effects of mutual inclinations between planets on the stability of planetary systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We showed that mutual inclination increases the likelihood of instability when two planets become locked in a 2:1 resonance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, my third project explored the possibility for detecting terrestrial planets around white dwarfs through gravitational microlensing events.

 We present an optimal design method to find the best occulting mask that can be used in direct imaging searches for extrasolar planets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method was based on the concept of entropy maximization, which has been widely applied in many fields such as information theory and statistical mechanics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this concept can get extended into the field of optics by introducing a new quantity called optical entropy (OE).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By using OE we are able to quantify the amount of information contained within each point spread function produced by different masks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This allows us to determine the most efficient mask shape in respect to its ability to detect faint companions around bright stars.   .

 [more]  In order to demonstrate our approach, we have performed numerical simulations to compare the performance of several candidate masks against one another.

 We present radiative transfer models for the dust distributions in two edge-on spiral galaxies, NGC 891 and NGC 4565.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The model parameters were constrained by fitting to near-infrared (NIR) observations at 2.2 microns with NICMOS on HST as well as optical data obtained with WFPC-2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that both galaxies have significant amounts of dust distributed along their disks out to large distances above the midplane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we detect an extended halo component around each galaxy which is best described by a spherical shell-like structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In NGC 891 this component has a scale height of 1 kpc and extends up to 5 kpc above the disk plane.

 The mechanical properties of hair is determined by its molecular structure, which is mainly composed of proteins called keratins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main structural unit in keratins is an alpha-helical coiled coil that forms microfibrils with other similar units to form intermediate filaments (IFs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These IFs then aggregate into bundles forming macrofibrils, which are further bundled together to form the basic building blocks of hair -the cortical cells-.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we have studied how the mechanical properties change as these structures evolve during the process known as maturation or ageing.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used confocal Raman spectroscopy to measure the changes to the secondary structure of individual keratin fibres extracted from human scalp hairs at different stages of their growth cycle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the elastic modulus increases significantly when the fibre goes through the transformation from the alpha helix conformation to the beta-sheet one.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We propose to use the concept of Maxwell's demon in order to explain how nanodevices can become used for information processing, storage or transmission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this approach is useful because it allows us to understand why some devices are more efficient than others at performing these tasks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we consider two types of nanodevices which have been proposed recently as candidates for quantum computers - spin chains and arrays of coupled cavities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first type consists of an array of spins arranged on a line with nearest neighbour interactions between them while the second one has a similar structure but instead of spins it contains atoms trapped inside optical cavities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For both cases we calculate their efficiency using the Landauer principle.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we discuss possible experimental implementations of our ideas.

 Introduction:-The idea of Maxwell's demon is introduced by James Clerk Maxwell (1831-1879)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It describes a hypothetical intelligent being who could control microscopic particles individually so that they would always move into separate containers depending on whether each particle had a higher energy level or lower energy level [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Maxwell's demon is usually described as a thought experiment whose purpose is to demonstrate that entropy cannot decrease spontaneously [3] , i.e., that heat does not flow spontaneously from hot bodies to cold ones [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there exists another interpretation of Maxwell's demon according to which he imagined a device capable of sorting individual molecules based on their velocities [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This interpretation leads naturally to the question about what sort of physical system might behave like such a device [6] .

 We present an analysis of the kinematics, metallicity distribution function (MDF), and chemical abundances in the outer halo of our Galaxy using data obtained with the Subaru Telescope for two fields along the leading arm of the Magellanic stream.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the MDFs are well represented by three Gaussian components centered at [Fe/H] = -1.7, -0.9, and +0.2 dex, respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The metal-poor component was found to be associated with the Galactic thick disk/halo population, while both intermediate- and high-metallicity populations show significant differences between the two fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular, we detect a large fraction of high-alpha stars in one field but not in another located farther away from the center of the LMC.

 These results suggest that the origin of these streams may have been triggered by tidal interactions between the Milky Way and its satellite galaxies such as the Sgr dwarf galaxy and/or the LMC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The collision between the Milky Way and its nearest neighbor, M31 (Andromeda), is predicted to occur in about 4 billion years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This will be one of the most spectacular events ever witnessed by humans.

 In this talk I will describe how we can use observations made with telescopes on Earth as well as space-based observatories such as Hubble Space Telescope to study these collisions and learn more about dark matter, galaxies, stars, black holes, and other cosmic phenomena that are part of our universe.

 I will also discuss some of my research projects related to studying galaxy mergers using data obtained at the W.M. Keck Observatory located on Mauna Kea, Hawaii.

 Finally, I'll share what it was like for me to work there during my summer internship last year.

 We present an algorithm to solve numerically the time-dependent equations describing the growth in ionized regions in the early universe, based on the Weighted Essentially Non-Oscillatory (WENO) scheme.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The numerical solution is obtained by solving simultaneously two coupled partial differential equations that describe the evolution of the ionization fraction and temperature fields inside each cell of a grid covering the computational domain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this method can be used to study the reionization process driven by UV photons emitted by galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we compare our results with those obtained using the Smooth Particle Hydrodynamics technique.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our tests indicate that both methods are able to reproduce qualitatively similar results but there are some quantitative differences between them which may have important consequences when studying the statistical properties of the IGM during the reionization epoch.

 We present X-ray luminosity functions (XLFs) for normal galaxies at z=0.5-2, based on deep Chandra observations of the Great Observatories Origins Deep Survey-North field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use photometric redshifts to select galaxy samples of different stellar masses and star formation rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The XLFs were derived by fitting the observed number counts using a Schechter function plus an exponential cutoff below Lx=1041 erg s-1.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the faint-end slope is steeper than -1.0 for all mass bins considered here.

 For massive galaxies (log(M/Msun)>10), we find no significant evolution between z=1.6 and 0.7.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there appears to be some evidence for evolution towards lower characteristic luminosities as well as flatter slopes at higher redshift.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the most massive galaxies may have evolved into less luminous systems over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We also compare our results with previous studies which used shallower data or smaller sample sizes.

 The renormalization group is used to study the effective action in quantum gravity, which describes how matter fields interact with gravitons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The gravitational field equations are derived by varying this action with respect to the metric tensor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach leads to an understanding of why general relativity has no ultraviolet divergences at one-loop order (i.e., when only one graviton loop is included).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also provides insight on the physical meaning of the cosmological constant term that appears in Einstein's field equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it allows us to calculate corrections to the classical theory due to higher-order terms in the expansion of the effective action about flat space-time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some open problems related with the application of these techniques to more complicated theories such as superstrings or supergravity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The renormalization group was applied to the problem of studying the effective action in quantum-gravitational systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We derive the gravitational field equations from varying this action with regard to the metric tensor.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results provide insights about the physical meaning of both the cosmological constant appearing in Einstein's field equations and the corrections to the classical theory arising from higher-order terms in the effective-action expansion around flat spacetime.

 The Riemann hypothesis is one of the most famous open problems in mathematics and has been studied for more than 150 years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we present an outline of the proof that was announced by Andrew Wiles on 16 May 1993 at the International Congress of Mathematicians in Zurich.

 The full text can be found here.

 The Riemann hypothesis is one of  the most famous open problems  in mathematics and has remained investigated for over 150 years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It states that all non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function have real part equal to 1/2.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This theorem will be proved using the theory of modular forms.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A modular form is a complex-valued function defined on the group SL(2,Z) which satisfies certain conditions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We begin with some basic definitions and properties of modular forms before moving onto the main topic of the article - the proof of the Riemann hypothesis given by Andrew Wiles.

 On further reading see [1] .

 We report the discovery of a new isolated neutron star (INS) candidate, PSR J1852+0040, in the southern hemisphere using data collected by the Parkes radio telescope and the Australia Telescope Compact Array (ATCA).

 We have also detected its X-ray counterpart in archival Chandra observations.

 This source appears point-like and shows no evidence of extended emission.

 Based on these properties we conclude that this object is likely to be a young INS.

 If confirmed as such, our results will provide important constraints on models of pulsar formation and evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that LAEs were distributed over a wide range of environments; they exist both in isolated regions as well as in dense clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The clustering properties of LAEs depend on their luminosities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we found that bright LAEs show stronger clustering than faint ones do.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result suggests that bright LAEs may be more evolved systems compared to fainter ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, we investigated the dependence of clustering strength on the equivalent widths of Lyman-alpha emission lines.

 These findings imply that there exists some evolutionary link between LAEs and LBGs.

 We study the mechanical properties in disordered networks of fibers with different bending rigidities by means of numerical simulations based on molecular dynamics (MD) and Monte Carlo (MC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the elastic moduli are strongly dependent on the bending rigidity, which are related to the persistence length of the fibers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that the shear modulus increases as the bending rigidity decreases while the bulk modulus remains almost unchanged for all values of the bending rigidity studied here.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we observe that the distribution functions of forces acting between particles depend significantly on the bending rigidity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For small bending rigidities there exist strong correlations among neighboring particles leading to large fluctuations in the local stress field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These findings suggest that the microscopic structure plays an important role in determining macroscopic material properties such as elasticity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Disordered networks of fibers have been widely used to model various materials ranging from biological tissues to granular media

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it has not yet become fully understood how the microstructure affects their macroscopic behavior.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we investigate the problem using computer simulation techniques.

 We show that this system exhibits a rich phase diagram as function of temperature T , interaction strength U0 and asymmetry parameter .

 The main results are: (i)

 At small values of we find three different phases: a low-temperature disordered phase, a high-temperature ordered phase and a critical point separating them.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (ii) In the limit of large barriers between the wells, i.e., when becomes very large or T decreases to zero, the transition line approaches the value Uc = 2U0/3 predicted by mean-field theory.

 They can be found in biological systems such as proteins [7][8][9], but also occur in synthetic materials like micelles [10]-[12].
