Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The question whether time is an illusion or not has remained debated for centuries, and the answer remains elusive.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we will examine some of the arguments that have been put forward in favour of the existence of time as well as those against it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We will then consider how these arguments relate to our understanding of space-time and its relationship with matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we must look at how quantum mechanics may provide us with new insights into the nature of time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The question "Does time exist?" has been asked many times throughout history by philosophers, scientists and ordinary people alike.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It seems like such a simple question but there are actually several different ways one can interpret what "time" means when asking about its existence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if you ask yourself "Is time real?"

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 your answer might be yes because you think that time is something that exists independently of any observer (i.e., outside of ourselves).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand, if you were to ask yourself "Do I experience time passing?" your answer would probably be no since you believe that only humans experience time.

 We study the glass transition as an ensemble of adhesive hard spheres with repulsive interactions decaying as 1/r6, where r is distance between particles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this system exhibits two distinct relaxation processes at low temperatures: one fast process associated with local rearrangements within clusters of strongly bonded particles; another slower process related to collective motion of these clusters.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter process can be described by mode-coupling theory (MCT) for colloidal suspensions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, we show that MCT fails quantitatively when applied directly to our data because it does not take into account the presence of strong bonds which lead to additional slow modes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After introducing a simple modification to MCT, we are able to obtain excellent agreement with experimental results over several decades in time and frequency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This modified version of MCT also predicts correctly the temperature dependence of the structural relaxation time near Tg.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our work shows how quantitative tests of theoretical predictions may help improve their accuracy and applicability range.

 We study the ground state properties of an interacting electron gas confined to a onedimensional (1D) quantum dot with parabolic confinement potential and repulsive Coulomb interaction between electrons.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that, for sufficiently strong confining potential, the system undergoes a phase transition into a deformed Wigner crystal at low temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were obtained by using density functional theory within the local spin-density approximation combined with exact diagonalization method.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this regime, we find that the charge distribution was characterized by alternating peaks separated by valleys which become more pronounced as temperature decreases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This behavior can be understood in terms of formation of a periodic structure due to inter-particle correlations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that such structures may exist experimentally in semiconductor nanowires or carbon nanotubes.

 We study evolutionary games played by agents that are randomly distributed over the nodes of an unstructured network, and interact only with their immediate neighbors in this network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to compute Nash equilibria for such games using local computations at each node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our approach is based on computing best responses locally at every agent's neighborhood, which we then use as input to a global algorithm that computes all Nash equilibria.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main technical challenge lies in showing that our local algorithms terminate after polynomially many rounds (in terms of the number of players), even though they may be executed concurrently across different parts of the network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result holds under mild assumptions about the underlying interaction graph.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it applies to any undirected connected graph where there exists some constant upper bound on the degree of its vertices.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a consequence, we obtain polynomial-time algorithms for finding Nash equilibria in several classes of games including congestion games, matching pennies games, and coordination games.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The universal spectrum is the most important concept in physics and mathematics, which has been widely used to study various physical phenomena such as energy transfer processes in biological systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present an analysis on the universal spectrum of the DNA base CG frequency distribution along the chromosomes of Takifugu rubripe s(pufferfish).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there are two different types of universal spectra corresponding to the coding regions and non-coding regions respectively.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The universal spectrum of the coding region shows a power law behavior with exponent 1.5 while that of the noncoding region exhibits a fractal structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the universal spectrum can been used to characterize the complexity of the DNA sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It will also provide new insights into the understanding of the evolution process of the genomes.

 The dynamics-based approach is an emerging method of studying terrestrial exoplanets, which are planets with masses similar to that of Earth orbiting other stars in the solar system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The goal is to produce a set of simulated data that can be used as input for any number of codes, and then have each code run on this same dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This would allow us to determine how well these codes agree with one another in terms of both the physical quantities they predict (e.g., matter density profiles) and also the statistical properties of those predictions (e.g., power spectra).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ADMX experiment consists of two main components: an antenna and a microwave cavity system that can be tuned over a wide range of frequencies.

 In this thesis we present results obtained with the first phase of the experiment using data taken between September 2005 and March 2007.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report limits to the coupling strength of axions to photons as well as limits on the mass of axions produced via Primakoff conversion inside a strong magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results improve on previous experimental bounds by more than one order of magnitude.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work is performed under the auspices of the U.S Department of Energy by Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory under Contract DE-AC52-07NA27344.

 The experiment consists of two main parts: an antenna and a microwave resonator system that will be tunable across a large frequency range.

 In this dissertation I will discuss our recent results from the first stage of the experiment.

 The observed luminosities are comparable to those found for ultraluminous infrared galaxies, but the ratios between these lines suggest the this is not an active galactic nucleus (AGN) dominated source.

 Instead we propose that the high-excitation molecular gas may be associated with a young massive starburst which has recently been triggered by tidal interactions and/or mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that there could be a deeply-embedded AGN present within the central few hundred parsecs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We study gravitational wave signals in chaotic systems by using the point mass model with an accretion disk around it, which is one of the most promising candidates for gravitational wave sources in astrophysics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that there are two types of gravitational waves emitted from such systems:  The first type comes from the orbital motion of the binary system and its frequency spectrum has peaks at integer multiples of the orbital frequency.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second type comes from the spiral structure formed on the surface of the accretion disk due to tidal interaction between the central black hole and the surrounding matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Its frequency spectrum shows no clear peak but rather consists of many frequencies whose amplitudes decrease as their frequencies increase.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we find that the amplitude of the second type of gravitational waves can be much larger than that of the first type when the spin parameter of the central black hole is large enough (a > 0.9).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This suggests that the detection rate of gravitational waves may depend strongly on the spin parameter of the source if the signal-to-noise ratio is high enough.

 We present an analysis of the evolution of early-type galaxies (ETGs) in hydrodynamical cosmological simulations, focusing on their formation history as well as their internal structure at z = 0.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to this major merger channel for forming ETGs, we show that minor mergers can also contribute significantly to the growth of massive ETGs by bringing in fresh cold gas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results suggest that both processes play important roles in shaping the observed properties of local ETGs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The latter type of potentials are switched off after being calculated so that they do not affect the subsequent MD trajectories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this scheme can be implemented into existing MD codes with minimal modifications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we demonstrate its effectiveness through several examples including liquid argon, water clusters, and carbon nanotubes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The LB technique was used to transfer these films onto various substrate materials such as silicon wafers, quartz slides, glass coverslips, gold-coated glass coverslips, and indium tin oxide coated glass coverslips.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Carbon nanotubes (CNTs), which were discovered about ten years ago, have attracted considerable attention as they possess unique physical properties including high electrical conductivity, mechanical strength, thermal stability, chemical inertness, etc., making them promising candidates for many potential applications ranging from field emission devices to sensors and optoelectronic devices1-5.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, most of their practical uses require CNT networks with controlled orientation and density6-8.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Among those techniques, Langmuir-Blodgett (LB) deposition has emerged as one of the most powerful approaches13-15.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process involves spreading a monolayer of amphiphilic molecules at the air-water interface followed by vertical dipping of a hydrophobic substrate into the water subphase16-18.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By repeating the above steps, multilayered thin films consisting of closely packed CNTs could be obtained19-21.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Compared to other methods22-24, LB deposition offers advantages such as precise control of layer thickness25-27, easy fabrication of large-area uniform films28-30, and possibility of fabricating patterned structures31-33.

 and have been known to be magnetically active for many years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The author presents an alternative approach to teaching special relativity by using the concept of transformation groups and their generators, which are used in physics for describing symmetry properties of physical systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main idea is that students can learn about the foundations of special relativity without having to deal with complicated mathematical concepts such as tensors or spinor fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This article describes how this method works on examples related to the Lorentz transformations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also discusses some possible applications for these ideas in other areas of physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, it shows how one could use them to explain the origin of gauge symmetries in quantum field theory.

 Special relativity (SR) has been taught at many universities since its discovery in 1905 [1] .

 However, despite numerous attempts [2] , there still exists no generally accepted way of introducing SR into undergraduate courses [3] .

 In recent years, several authors have proposed new approaches to teaching SR

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 Introduction -Lepton Flavor Violation (LFV), i.e., the process where one observes a transition between different flavors of leptons, has become studied extensively both theoretically [1] and experimentally

 [2] , since it was first proposed more than thirty years ago [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, supersymmetric models [6] , left-right symmetric models [7] , and extra-dimensional theories [8] all contain new sources of LFV interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 As shown below, these LFV processes can occur at observable rates even when the corresponding couplings are extremely small [16] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It has been shown to grow and divide indefinitely without any external control signals (such as hormones).

 [6] , it is difficult to determine the true space densities accurately.

 We find that these features were well reproduced in our non-LTE model calculations assuming an electron density ne = 1 x 10^9 cm-3 , temperature Te = 5500 K , and mass-loss rate oḟ M = 2 x 10^-6 M_sun/yr.

 We present an approach to decision tree learning that uses views over the data in order to improve efficiency and scalability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed method is based on the idea of using multiple views, each one capturing different aspects or features of the same dataset.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this can been achieved by defining a set of views for each node in the decision tree model being learned.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These views are then used as input to a modified version of the standard ID3 algorithm which learns the decision tree structure.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our experimental results demonstrate significant improvements on terms of both accuracy and execution time when compared against existing approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Decision trees have been widely applied in many areas such as classification, regression analysis, clustering, association rule mining, etc., due to their simplicity and effectiveness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, they suffer from two main drawbacks: (1) high computational cost; and (2) poor scalability.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, the number of possible splits at any given internal node grows exponentially with respect to the size of its parent's training sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes it difficult to design large decision trees efficiently.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To address these problems we propose a novel approach called Relational Views-based Decision Tree Learning (RV-DTL).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 RV-DTL builds on the concept of multi-view learning where each view captures some aspect(s) of the original data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 More specifically, our approach defines a set of views for every internal node in the decision tree being built.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Each view corresponds with a specific feature subset associated with the corresponding node.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, instead of building the entire decision tree from scratch, RV-DTL starts with small sub-trees rooted at leaf nodes and iteratively expands them towards the root until all leaves are reached.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 At each expansion step, RV-DTL selects the best split among those available according to the information gain criterion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, the final decision tree was constructed by merging together.

 The Coulomb drag effect is the phenomenon where one charge carrier can transfer energy to another by exchanging virtual phonons, leading to an electric current in the second carrier that opposes its own motion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we study the Coulomb drag between two graphene sheets separated by a dielectric spacer layer and subject to different gate voltages.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that for small separation distances (less than 10 nm) there are significant deviations from the predictions based on the standard theory developed for bulk materials.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These deviations arise due to the presence of evanescent modes which couple strongly with the carriers at low energies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For larger separations these effects become negligible as expected.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results presented here provide useful information about how to design devices such as transistors or thermoelectric generators using graphene layers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 I. INTRODUCTIO N Graphene has attracted considerable attention recently as it exhibits unique electronic properties [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It consists of carbon atoms arranged into a honeycomb lattice structure and behaves like a two-dimensional electron gas when doped [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One interesting property of graphene is the so-called Coulomb drag effect

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , i.e., the generation of an electric current in a second sheet of electrons moving through a first sheet of electrons even though they do not interact directly [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect arises because both carriers exchange virtual phonons via their mutual interaction mediated by the substrate [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In a result, the current density in the second carrier depends on the velocity of the first carrier [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Since the discovery of the Coulomb drag effect in semiconductors [7, 8] many theoretical studies have been performed [9] - [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, only very few experiments are carried out so far [12] -

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14] mainly due to difficulties associated with fabricating samples with high quality interfaces [15] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, several groups succeeded in growing high-quality epitaxial graphene [16] - [18] opening up new possibilities for studying the Coulomb drag effect experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We report the observation of electron-hole puddles in graphene using scanning single-electron transistors (SETs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SET is fabricated on top of an exfoliated monolayer graphene flake and operated at cryogenic temperatures down to 4 K. We observe that the conductance through the SET depends strongly on its position with respect to the underlying graphene sheet, which we attribute to local variations in charge carrier density induced by charged impurities trapped between the substrate and the graphene layer.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This effect can been suppressed by applying a gate voltage Vg = -40 V across the graphene sample.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results demonstrate that the use of SETs as probes for studying electronic properties of two-dimensional materials such as graphene has great potential.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there have been significant advances in the fabrication of devices based on carbon nanotubes [1] , silicon nanowires [2] or semiconductor quantum dots [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These nanostructures were used as active elements in various types of sensors [4] , optoelectronic [5] and photovoltaic [6] applications.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, these structures suffer with several drawbacks including poor reproducibility due to their small size and low yield during growth processes

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By contrast, graphene [9] offers many advantages over other two dimensional materials [10] : it is mechanically flexible [11] , chemically stable

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [12] , biocompatible [13] and electrically conductive [14] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, it can be produced in large quantities via chemical vapor deposition

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [15] and mechanical exfoliation [16] techniques [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently, graphene-based field-effect transistors [18] were demonstrated [19, 20] opening up new avenues towards high-performance electronics [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With all these attractive features, however, one major challenge remains in achieving high-quality electrical contacts to graphene [22] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We find that all but one star show an overabundance of Li compared to the Sun by factors ranging from 2 up to 6 times its solar value.

 This is consistent with previous studies which found similar results for other clusters such as M71 or NGC6397.

 We present the results of an analysis to determine whether physical vetoes can become used as part of a pipeline to reduce false alarms in searches for gravitational waves (GWs) from binary black hole mergers and other astrophysical sources.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use data collected by the LIGO detectors during their fifth science run, which took place between September 2005 and January 2007.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The search pipeline is based on matched filtering with template waveforms that are generated using post-Newtonian expansions up to 3PN order.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition to standard cuts applied to the signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), we also apply two different types of physical vetoes:  1) Vetoing events whose SNRs exceed some threshold value when they occur simultaneously at multiple detector sites; 2) Vetoing events where there is evidence of excess power above background noise levels in the frequency bands below 100 Hz or above 1000 Hz.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Within each type of veto, we define a set of parameters that control its effectiveness.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using these parameters, we perform Monte Carlo simulations to study how well the vetoes reject simulated signals injected with real detector data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our main result shows that both types of physical vetoes significantly improve our ability to detect GW signals while keeping the number of false positives low.

(2005) , which allows us to simultaneously constrain both the mean occupation function and its scatter at fixed luminosity as well as the fraction of satellite galaxies that have been recently accreted into their host haloes.

 The problem of finding the energy levels of an electron bound to a nucleus is one of the most important problems in physics, which has become studied for many years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this article we consider the case where there are two electrons with opposite spins that can occupy different orbitals around the same nucleus.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to compute these states using only polynomial time computations on classical computers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result was obtained by applying some techniques developed recently in computational complexity theory such as the PCP theorem (the probabilistic checkable proof) and the local testability of CSPs (constraint satisfaction problems).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results presented here have applications not only in theoretical physics but also in computer science.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In example they provide new insights into the structure of NP-complete problems.

 Quantum mechanical systems play an essential role within modern physics.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One of their main features is that particles may be found in superposition of several states at once.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A famous example is Schrödinger's cat experiment

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The feature is entanglement

 [2] , i.e., correlations between particles that cannot be explained classically

 From this work we study the following problem: given a system consisting of N spin-1/2 particles, what is the ground state?

 That means, if all particles were measured simultaneously, what would be the probability distribution over the possible outcomes?

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In smaller mass PBHs with M < 10^(10)g, we use numerical simulations to determine the accretion rate as a function of time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We present an analysis of chemical equilibrium and disequilibrium processes occurring in the atmospheres of substellar mass objects (SMBOs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We have developed a new method for calculating departures from chemical equilibrium, which is based on the assumption that all species are in local thermodynamic equilibrium with each other at any given point within the atmosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach allows us to calculate the abundances of individual molecular species as functions of altitude above the photosphere.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The multifractal nature of the human heartbeat has was studied by many authors, but most studies have focused on short time series (typically less than one hour).

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This indicates that the ECGs become more monofractal-like when longer recordings are considered.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that for any network with n nodes there are at most 2n eigenvalues different from zero (counting multiplicities).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This bound is tight up to a constant factor when applied to trees or complete graphs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 We find that the ejecta are expanding at velocities between 1000 km/s to 3000 km/s.

 From our observations we derive a distance estimate for this object of about 3 kpc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is consistent to previous estimates derived using other methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using these results as input parameters into theoretical models, we determine the chemical composition of the ejecta.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our best fit model suggests that the ejecta consist mainly of O-rich material mixed with some CNO-processed material.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, we detect strong emission lines originating from highly ionized species such as FeXXV/FeXXVI or NeIX/NX.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These lines indicate that the ejecta were heated up to temperatures above 10 million K during their expansion.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of an X-ray study of supernova remnant (SNR) G299.2-2.9 using data obtained with Chandra and XMM-Newton observatories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SNR was located in the constellation Puppis at a distance of ~5 kpc, which corresponds to its angular size of about 30 arcmin.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the spectrum of this object can be described by two thermal components with temperatures T1=7×10^6 K and T2=2×10^6 K.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 By addition, we detect non-thermal emission above 10 keV. Using these parameters, we estimate the age of the SNR as t=4000 yr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This value agrees well to the characteristic time for the expansion of the shell into the surrounding medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Based on our analysis, we conclude that the observed morphology of the SNR is consistent with the model of a spherical explosion expanding into a uniform interstellar medium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose that the dark matter (DM) and supersymmetric particles are generated by an emergent gauge symmetry at high energy scales, which is broken down to Standard Model symmetries below TeV scale.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The DM candidate can been identified as a pseudo-Nambu-Goldstone boson associated with spontaneous breaking of global U(1) symmetry.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this scenario would explain various experimental results on DM searches including recent LHC data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we discuss possible collider signatures for future experiments such as ILC or CLIC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction: Dark matter (DM), whose existence has become inferred through its gravitational effects over many decades

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , remains one among the most mysterious phenomena in particle physics today [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Although here have been numerous proposals for explaining the origin of DM

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , none of them have yet provided compelling evidence for their viability

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work, motivated by the idea of "emergent" theories [5] - [8] , we consider a new possibility where DM emerges from a spontaneously-broken global symmetry [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This approach provides a simple explanation for why DM could exist without introducing any additional fields beyond those already present within the Standard Model

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Furthermore, it allows us to identify the DM candidate for a pseudo-NambuGoldstone boson

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [11] , thereby providing a natural solution for the so-called "WIMP miracle" [12] problem

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our model also predicts the presence of light scalar superpartners

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14] , which may provide interesting signals at upcoming high-energy accelerator facilities

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The rest of this article is organised as follows.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In Sec. 2, we introduce our theoretical framework based upon emergent gauge mediation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, in Secs. 3-7, we demonstrate how this framework could simultaneously address all current experimental constraints

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [20] while predicting novel phenomenological features [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, in Sec. 8, we conclude with some remarks about further directions of research.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present new observations of the kinematic properties of the dense gas associated with the young stellar cluster forming within the Ophiuchus molecular cloud (d = 140 pc).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We used the Submillimeter Array to observe two fields, one centered on the infrared source IRAS 04368+2557 and another located about 1 arcmin away at the position of the Spitzer c2d survey target L1641N. The data reveal that both regions were characterized by complex velocity structures which we interpret as being due to multiple overlapping protostellar cores.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, our results show that:  -The region surrounding IRAS 04368+25570 was dominated by three distinct components separated by less than 0.1 pc along the line-of-sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The region of L1641N contains several compact sources embedded in an extended envelope whose emission peaks at velocities between 5 and 10 km s-1 relative to the local standard of rest.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -Both regions contain numerous outflows driven by protostars still deeply embedded in their natal envelopes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Peierls-Nabarro model was used to study the dislocations dynamics in a crystal lattice, where the energy barrier for glide motion and climb motion are calculated by using the concept of activation volume.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that the energy barriers increase with increasing applied stress.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It also shows that the energy barrier decreases as temperature increases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally it can been concluded that the Peierls-Nabarre model gives good agreement between theory and experimentation.

 Keywords: Energy Barrier, Dislocation, Glide Motion, Climb Motion, Activation Volume, Peierls-Nabarrou Model.

 1 Introduction In this research work we have studied the dislocation dynamics in a crystal lattice which has been done by using the Peierls-Nabbarro model [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This model was developed by Peierls

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , who introduced an elastic strain field into the Frenkel-Kontorova model [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to calculate the energy barrier for gliding motion and climbing motion, we use the concept of activation volume [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find out how the energy barrier changes when different values of stresses were applied on the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Also we found out how the energy barrier varies at different temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we compare our theoretical results with experimental data [5] - [8] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the controllability properties of quantum subsystems that are described by a master equation with Lindblad form.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how to construct invariant sets of such systems in terms of their generators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results allow us to prove that certain classes of open quantum systems cannot become controlled using only unitary operations on the system's Hilbert space.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we present an algorithm which allows one to determine whether or not a given set is invariant under the dynamics generated by a particular generator.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This work was supported by NSF grant PHY-0456628.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quantum mechanics has been successfully applied to many physical phenomena ranging from atomic physics to condensed matter theory.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it remains unclear what exactly constitutes a quantum mechanical description of reality.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One approach for answering this question involves studying the behavior of closed quantum systems whose states evolve according to Schrödinger equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Another approach focuses on describing the evolution of open quantum systems where the state of the system interacts continuously with its environment.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The latter class of problems can often be formulated as questions about the controllability of quantum dynamical systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, consider the problem of steering the state of a two-level atom between different energy levels using laser pulses.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The transcription process is driven by the enzyme RNA Polymerase (RNAP) that moves along the template strand of double stranded DNA and synthesizes an mRNA molecule in front of it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The RNAPs are highly dynamic enzymes, which may pause or arrest at specific sites during their translocation through the gene sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 From this work we study how these pauses affect the overall rate of transcription using a coarse-grained model for the dynamics of multiple RNAP molecules moving simultaneously on a single DNA chain.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that the presence of pausing leads to a reduction in the average speed of transcription elongation as well as to a decrease in the total number of synthesized mRNAs per unit time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results suggest that the observed heterogeneity in the rates of transcription may be due to differences in the density of paused RNAPs between genes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Transcription is one of the fundamental processes in all living organisms where information stored in the form of genetic code is converted into messenger RNA (mRNA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This conversion takes place within the cell nucleus when the enzyme called RNA Polymerase (or simply RNAP) binds with promoter region of the gene and starts copying its sequence

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 During transcription, the RNAP travels along the template strand of doublestranded DNA and synthesizes an RNA molecule in front of itself [2] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In recent years there has been significant progress towards understanding the mechanism behind transcription

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3, 4] , however many questions remain unanswered [5] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One such question concerns the effect on pausing events on the overall rate of transcription [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It was shown experimentally

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [7, 8] that the RNAPs tend to pause frequently while traveling through the gene sequence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, the duration for each pause event varies widely depending on the type of the gene [9] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, some genes have short pauses lasting only few milliseconds [10] whereas others exhibit much longer pauses up to several seconds [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We propose that the fuzzball proposal for black holes can be extended to include internal degrees of freedom, which are excited by infalling matter and produce Hawking radiation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this idea fits in the framework of string theory in AdS/CFT correspondence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed model was based on an extension of the work done by Horowitz and Maldacena (HM) who showed that the entropy of extremal Kerr-Newman black hole agrees exactly with the microscopic counting of states in N=4 super Yang-Mills gauge theory at strong coupling.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For our case we consider non-extremal black holes whose entropy also matches with the number of microstates in strongly coupled field theories but now including internal degrees of freedom.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This leads us to conclude that the emission spectrum of these black holes should agree with the one predicted by Hawking's original calculation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss some open questions related with this new picture of black holes as well as possible experimental tests.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an algorithm for computing the semidefinite representation (SDR) of convex sets in arbitrary dimensions, which was based on solving linear programs with polynomial number of constraints and variables.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SDR can be used to solve many problems that are NP-hard or even undecidable by reducing them into tractable convex optimization problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this approach can be applied to several important computational problems such as finding Nash equilibria in games, learning graphical models, and approximating mixed integer programming problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally we discuss some open questions related to our work.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Semidefinite representations provide a powerful tool in solving hard computational problems via convex optimization.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular they allow us to reduce intractable problems like finding Nash equilibria in multiplayer games, learning graphical models and approximating mixed-integer programming problems to tractable convex optimization problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This talk will give an overview over recent results on algorithms for computing semidefinite representations of convex sets.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It will also explain how these techniques can be applied to various computational problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Sun is the nearest star to Earth, and its activity has become studied for thousands of years.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Sun's magnetic field plays an important role during solar activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will discuss how we can use observations made by spacecraft such as SOHO (Solar and Heliospheric Observatory) and SDO (Solar Dynamics Observatory), together with ground-based telescopes on the Canary Islands, to study the Sun's magnetic fields and their relationship to solar activity.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This research helps us understand what happens when stars like our Sun die out - they become red giants that eject huge amounts of material into space which will eventually form new planets or even life elsewhere in the Universe.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Keywords: Solar Activity, Red Giant Star, Magnetic Field, Space Weather.

 We present an efficient scheme for solving the self-consistent problem within the framework of Dynamical Mean-Field Theory (DMFT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The method is based on a linearized version of the Muffin-Tin orbital approach, which allows to treat large systems with thousands of atoms at low computational cost.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our results are in good agreement with those obtained by other methods such as exact diagonalization or Quantum Monte Carlo simulations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we study the evolution of the electronic structure across the metal-insulator transition in the Hubbard model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how this new technique can be used to investigate more complex materials like doped semiconductors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Introduction: Dynamical Mean Field Theory (DMFT) has been widely applied to describe strongly correlated electron systems

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It provides a powerful tool to understand many-body effects in standard band-structure calculations [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, its application in real materials requires the solution of a complicated quantum impurity problem [5] , whose numerical treatment becomes very demanding when dealing with realistic models

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In order to overcome these difficulties several techniques have be developed [7-10].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Of them, the most popular ones are the iterative perturbation theory [11] , the non-crossing approximation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [12] , a variational cluster approach

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [13] , a cellular DMFT

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [14] , the continuous-time QMC [15] , and the exact diagonalization

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 All these approaches require the calculation of the Green's function G(k,ω), which depends on two variables k and ω.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This makes their direct evaluation extremely time consuming even if one uses fast Fourier transforms [17] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To avoid this difficulty, it is proposed to use the so-called LMTOs

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [18] instead of Bloch functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These orbitals were constructed so that they reproduce exactly the density matrix inside each atomic sphere [19] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They allow us to reduce considerably the number of degrees of freedom involved in the calculation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Moreover, since the LMTOs do not depend explicitly on the wave vector k, the corresponding Green's function only needs to be calculated once [21] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The solar magnetic field is an important ingredient of many physical processes that take place on the Sun, such as coronal heating or solar wind acceleration.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The open magnetic flux threading in the heliosphere plays also a crucial role for space weather prediction.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present results obtained with the MHD model developed by Usmanov et al. (2010) to study the structure and dynamics of the Sun's open magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how the global properties of the simulated open magnetic field compare with observations made at 1 AU using spacecraft data.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our simulations reproduce well the observed latitudinal distribution for the open magnetic flux density and its dependence on the radial distance from the Sun.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They also provide information about the temporal evolution of the open magnetic field which can been used to predict the state of the interplanetary medium several days ahead.

 This research is supported by NASA grants NNX10AC85G (PI: S. Riley), NNG09FA40C (PI: A. Schwadron), and NNM07AA01A (PI: J. McComas).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the effect on rounding on the dynamics of complex networks with first-order phase transition (FPT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that FPTs can be rounded by adding or removing nodes, which leads to an increase in the number of cooperators at equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were obtained for both static and dynamic models of evolution of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that the presence of FPTs is necessary but not sufficient condition for high levels of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we propose a simple strategy for finding the best possible roundings leading to maximal level of cooperation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Rounding in first-order phase transistions and optimal cooperation in scale free networks.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we investigate how the presence of first order phase transitions affects the evolution of cooperation in social dilemmas.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 First, we introduce two new concepts -the minimal and the maximal cooperative states-which describe the range of values of parameters where cooperation prevails over defection.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, using these definitions, we prove that any system with first order phase transition has its own unique value of parameter corresponding to the maximum fraction of cooperators.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Next, we consider the problem for optimizing cooperation in such systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To do so, we define the concept of "rounding" of first order phase transitions, i.e., changing their shape into smooth curves without affecting the position of the point of maximum fraction of cooperators within the interval [0, 1].

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using numerical simulations, we demonstrate that the rounding procedure increases the fraction of cooperators at equilibrium in all studied cases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we present a method allowing one to determine the optimal rounding of given phase transition curve.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the phenomenological consequences of neutrino physics and cosmology in models where massive neutrinos are Majorana particles, i.e., their own antiparticles.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that such models can be constrained by current experiments on neutrinoless double beta decay (0νββ) as well as future ones.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we discuss how these constraints affect other phenomena like leptogenesis or dark matter searches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we comment on possible connections between 0νββ and lepton flavor violating processes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The Standard Model is an extremely successful description for particle interactions at low energies but it fails to explain several important issues including the origin of mass.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 One possibility to address this problem is to extend the SM to adding new fields which couple only very weakly to ordinary matter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Such extensions typically predict new light states beyond those already known experimentally.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 A particularly interesting class of theories contains right-handed neutrinos whose masses may be generated via seesaw mechanisms [1] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These heavy neutrinos will have observable effects in many different areas ranging from neutrino oscillations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [2] , rare decays

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [3] , collider signatures

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [4] , gravitational waves [5] , to cosmology [6] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we consider scenarios where the three active neutrinos ν e , ν µ , ν τ mix with one or more sterile neutrinos N 1 , . . .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 N n

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This mixing leads to additional contributions to the effective mass m ee = || 2 relevant for neutrinoless double-beta decay

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Current experimental bounds [10] imply that m ee <

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 O(10 −2 − 10 −1 eV).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Future experiments should improve these limits significantly [11] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 If the observed value turns out to be close to its upper bound then the corresponding scenario would provide evidence for Majorana neutrinos [12] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 On the other hand if no signal was found then the model predicts that all neutrinos are Dirac fermions [13] .

 The reaction mechanism for the ring-opening reactions of cyclic alkanes with water is was studied using density functional theory (DFT) and ab initio molecular orbital methods at the B3LYP/6-311++G(d,p), MP2/6-31+G*, QCISD/6-31+G* levels in conjunction with the CBS-QB3 method to calculate enthalpies of formation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results show that the activation energies are lower than those obtained previously by DFT or semiempirical methods.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, it was found that the transition states have one imaginary frequency along the reaction coordinate corresponding to the breaking of C-H bonds on both sides of the carbonyl group.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The calculated rate constants agree well to experimental data over a wide temperature range.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we propose an explanation for the observed differences between theoretical predictions and experiments based on the fact that the solvent effect is not taken into account in previous studies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an analytical model of the growth, radial drift and fragmentation of dust grains in protoplanetary disks that evolve under the combined effects of viscous accretion onto the central star and photoevaporation by external radiation fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how these processes affect the evolution of grain size distributions as well as their spatial distribution within the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For particular we find that: (i)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The maximum grain sizes are limited to values between 1 mm and 10 cm depending on the strength of the stellar UV field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (ii) Grains grow faster at larger distances from the star due to lower gas densities and higher temperatures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 (iii) Fragmentation is more efficient closer to the star where the local pressure maxima lead to enhanced collisional velocities.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These results have important implications for planet formation scenarios as they suggest that planetesimals can form only close to the star while large bodies such as asteroids or comets may be able to form farther out in the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the analysis of the magnetic field configuration in active region NOAA 11158, which produced several large solar flares during its passage across the central meridian on February 15-16, 2011 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use vector magnetograms obtained by SDO/HMI and SOHO/MDI instruments as well as photospheric line-of-sight magnetograms provided by GONG network.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The evolution of the coronal magnetic field was studied using potential-field source-surface (PFSS) model.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we perform NLFFF extrapolations with different codes for comparison purposes.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that both PFSS and NLFFF models are able to reproduce the large-scale structure of the corona but differ significantly at small scales.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This discrepancy can be explained by considering the effect of plasma flows along open field lines.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we study the relationship of the observed photospheric motions and the changes in the coronal magnetic field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Active Region NOAA 11158 was one of the most energetic regions ever recorded.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It produced several X-class flares including an X2.2 event on February 16, 2011 , when it crossed the central meridian.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Several authors have analyzed this active region before and after the flare occurrence.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They found evidence for strong shearing motions in the photosphere prior to the flare onset (e.g., Liu et al. , 2012; Petrie & Sudol 2010; Schrijver 2009 ).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These observations suggest that the energy release may be triggered by reconnection processes involving twisted flux tubes (Petrie 2013) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, there has been no detailed investigation into how these photospheric motions affect the coronal magnetic field or whether they trigger any significant reconfiguration of the magnetic field.

 We study the functional renormalization group (FRG) approach for quantum phase transitions in systems of interacting nonrelativistic bosons, focusing on its application to fermionic superfluids and superconductors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that FRG is able to capture both the mean-field behavior at weak coupling as well as the strong-coupling physics beyond it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we demonstrate how the FRG can been used to calculate the critical temperature Tc of the transition between normal state and superfluid/superconducting states.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were compared against those obtained by other methods such as Monte Carlo simulations or variational approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss possible extensions of our work which may lead to further improvements.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Quantum phase transitions occur when the ground-state properties of a system change abruptly upon varying some external parameter like pressure, magnetic field etc.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 They have been studied extensively over many years using various theoretical techniques ranging from perturbative expansions around the Fermi liquid fixed point

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [1] , to numerical calculations based upon exact diagonalizations

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Recently there has also been an increasing interest in applying the Functional Renormalization Group (FRG), originally developed within the context of strongly correlated electron systems [3] , to this problem [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this contribution we will focus on applications of the FRG method to fermionic superfluides and superconductors.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These phases arise due to pairing correlations among fermions leading to macroscopic occupation of single-particle states below certain energy scale called the gap.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This phenomenon became known as BCS-BEC crossover [5] where "BCS" stands for Bardeen-Cooper-Schrieffer theory

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [6] describing conventional s-wave superconductivity while "BEC" refers to Bose-Einstein condensation

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 [7, 8] occurring as p-wave superfluids

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 It turns out that these two limits correspond to different universality classes [10] so that one expects a smooth crossover between them [11] .

 We present statistical results of the long-term variability (LTV) properties of active galactic nuclei (AGNs).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use data obtained from the Owens Valley Radio Observatory (OVRO), University of California, Berkeley, and Metsähovi observatories over the period of 1989 and 2009 to study LTVs at time scales ranging between months through to several years for more than 100 sources.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The main goal is to investigate whether there are any differences in the LTV behavior among different classes of AGNs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we also aim to find out how the observed flux density variations depend on source luminosity and redshift.

 We study the gravity dual description of 1/2 BPS Wilson loops in N = 4 super Yang-Mills theory on R × S 3 .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that these operators are described by D-branes wrapping an S 2 inside AdS 5 and ending at the boundary of AdS 5 , where they end on a string which is stretched between two parallel D3 branes located at different points along the radial direction of AdS 5 .

 We present an ab initio tight-binding model for calculating the optical properties of semiconductor nanocrystals, which was based on the solution of the Bethe-Salpeter equation (BSE) within the framework of density functional theory (DFT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The BSE describes excitonic effects and allows to calculate absorption spectra with high accuracy.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that our approach reproduces experimental results very well.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we find good agreement between calculated and measured absorption cross sections at low energies where quantum confinement dominates over electron-hole exchange interactions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our method can be applied to any type of semiconductor material including doped systems as well as core-shell structures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Semiconductor nanocrystals are promising candidates for applications such as light-emitting diodes or solar cells due to their unique optoelectronic properties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, it remains challenging to predict these properties accurately as they depend sensitively on the electronic structure of the system.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Here we propose a new theoretical approach to tackle this problem of combining DFT calculations with the Bethe-Salpether equation (BSE), which takes into account excitonic effects beyond mean-field approaches like Kohn-Sham DFT.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This enables us to obtain accurate predictions about the optical properties of semiconductor nanostructures.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The thermal Casimir force is the quantum mechanical effect that arises when two objects are separated by vacuum, which causes them to attract each other due to zero-point fluctuations in their electromagnetic fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this talk I will present some recent results for the thermal Casimir force between dielectrics as well as related problems such as the van der Waals interaction between polarizable atoms or molecules at finite temperature.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first part of my talk will be devoted to an overview of our work on the subject published recently in Physical Review Letters (PRL)

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This includes new exact expressions for the thermal Casimir energy density and pressure valid for arbitrary temperatures and dielectric functions.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These formulas can also be used to calculate the leading order corrections to Lifshitz theory [2] , which has been widely applied to describe the Casimir force between real materials [3] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In the second part of my talk I will discuss how these results have been extended to include retardation effects [4] .

Rewrite the following paragraph:

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, in digital television transmission, the base station sends a coarse description of the video sequence to mobile users via satellite links.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Then, when these users get closer with their destination they request additional descriptions of higher resolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This process continues till the user receives enough data to reconstruct the original signal without error [5] .

 We report on the observation of strong electron-phonon interaction (EPI) in heavily boron-doped epitaxial graphene grown on SiC(0001).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The EPI was found to be enhanced by more than one order of magnitude compared with that observed for undoped graphene, which can be attributed to the formation of a Dirac point at high doping levels and its associated van Hove singularity near the Fermi level.

 Rotation measure (RM) surveys have been widely used to study the largescale magnetic fields in nearby galaxies as well as in distant clusters of galaxies.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, such studies are difficult to carry out in the central regions of the Galaxy due to strong foreground emission from ionized gas along the line-of-sight.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we report a survey of the large-scale magnetic field in front of the Galactic Center using rotation measures of extragalactic radio sources observed by the Australia Telescope Compact Array (ATCA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our sample consists from 1253 radio sources selected from the AT20G catalog based on their angular distances from the Galactic Center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Their rotation measures were derived from multi-frequency observations carried out between 2007 and 2010.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The resulting rotation measure map reveals a clear pattern with alternating positive and negative values across the sky.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 After fitting these data points with a simple axisymmetric model, we obtain a best-fit value of B = 3 μG for the mean magnetic field strength inside a radius of 2 kpc centered on the Galactic Center.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Beyond this region, the magnetic field strength drops quickly to less than 1 μG. Furthermore, there appears to exist a systematic deviation from axial symmetry around the GC.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present the results of an analysis of gravitational wave data collected by the LIGO and Virgo detectors during the first observing run (O1) in 2015, which includes two candidate events for binary neutron star mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use these observations to test general relativity against alternative theories of gravity that predict deviations from GR at high curvature regimes such as those encountered near black holes or neutron stars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular we consider scalar-tensor theories where the coupling between matter fields and the metric is mediated by a light scalar field.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These theories were motivated by string theory and have been studied extensively over many decades.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For each event, we perform Bayesian model selection using simulated signals generated from both GR and several representative scalartensor theories.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show no evidence of deviations from GR within current uncertainties.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, this does not rule out all possible deviations from GR; it only rules out certain classes of deviations predicted by specific models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We present an explanation for the excess in gamma-ray emission observed by the Energetic Gamma Ray Experiment Telescope (EGRET) at energies above 10 GeV, which is known as the "GeV anomaly".

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this excess can be explained if there are two populations of pulsars with different magnetic field strengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The first population consists of young pulsars whose fields decay rapidly due to their rapid spin-downs.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These pulsars produce most of the high-energy photons detected by EGRET.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The second population consists of older pulsars whose fields have decayed more slowly because they rotate slower than younger pulsars on average.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This second population produces less high-energy radiation but contributes significantly towards the total number of pulsars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our model predicts that Fermi should detect many new pulsar candidates not seen before.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we predict that some of these newly discovered pulsars will exhibit very high luminosities compared to other pulsars.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We study the critical Casimir effect (CCE) between two parallel plates immersed into a liquid helium film at its superfluid transition temperature T_sf = 2.17 K, using Monte Carlo simulations based on the density functional theory for quantum fluids.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that the CCE becomes strongly suppressed by the presence of the substrate and vanishes completely when the distance to it becomes smaller than about one molecular diameter.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The results were compared with those obtained within the mean-field approximation which overestimates the magnitude of the effect considerably.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we show how the influence of the substrate can been taken into account in an approximate way.

 We present the results of hydrodynamic simulations that show how supernova ejecta can interact with nearby protoplanetary disks and produce observable signatures in their infrared emission.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that, depending on disk properties (mass, radius), the interaction may lead to an increase or decrease in the total luminosity emitted by the system at near-infrared wavelengths.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The effect is strongest in massive disks around young stars; it decreases rapidly as the mass ratio between the star and its disk decreases.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition, we find that the interaction leads to significant changes in the temperature distribution within the disk.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These effects are most pronounced when the disk is relatively close to the supernova progenitor - less than 100 AU away.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In more distant systems, the impact of the supernova blast wave becomes negligible.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, our models suggest that the observed excesses in mid-infrared flux detected towards some T Tauri stars could be due to such interactions.

 We report the detection of an infrared dark cloud (IRDC) in the vicinity of the open cluster NGC 6334, using data obtained with Spitzer Space Telescope's Infrared Array Camera (IRAC).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The IRDC was associated with the molecular cloud complex G327.3+0.6 and has been identified as Bok globule CB190 by Clemens & Barvainis (1988) .

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that this object exhibits a prominent 24 micron shadow which may be caused by absorption against bright mid-infrared emission from nearby protostars or young stellar objects.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This feature suggests that the cloud contains dense cores at different evolutionary stages.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Using near-infrared extinction mapping we identify two candidate starless cores in the cloud.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 These were located near the center of the cloud where the 24 micron shadow is most pronounced.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our analysis shows that these cores have masses between 0.5 Msun to 1 Msun and radii ranging from 1000 AU to 3000 AU .

 We study how the presence in a central supermassive black hole (SMBH) affects the dynamical evolution and mass loss rate of an open cluster with N = 10, 000 stars in virial equilibrium.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use direct N-body simulations to follow the long-term evolution in this system for up to 1 Gyr.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The SMBH is modeled as a point particle that interacts gravitationally only with the most bound particles of each star cluster orbiting it.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show that the presence of the SMBH causes significant changes in the structure of the open cluster over time.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that:  -The open cluster loses about half its initial total mass within 0.5 Gyr due to tidal stripping by the SMBH.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The open cluster becomes more spherical after becoming tidally stripped by the SMBH.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 -The open cluster develops a core-halo structure where the density profile follows a power law for large radii but has a flat distribution near the center.

 We present an efficient computational method to compute the elastic properties, vibrational frequencies and normal modes of proteins using finite element analysis (FEA).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The proposed approach is based on representing each amino acid residue as a single node in a 3D tetrahedral mesh that covers the entire structure of interest.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show how this representation can be used within FEA to efficiently calculate the stiffness matrix associated with the system under study.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In addition we demonstrate how the same representation allows us to obtain accurate results when computing the eigenfrequencies and corresponding mode shapes in the system by solving the generalized eigenvalue problem arising from the discretized form of the governing equations.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we illustrate our methodology by several numerical examples involving different types of proteins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results indicate that the proposed approach provides highly accurate predictions compared to those obtained via other state-of-the-art methods such as molecular dynamics simulations or coarse-grained models.

 We study the adiabatic evolution of an open-boundary spin-1/2 chain with nearest-neighbor interactions, which are driven by slowly varying external magnetic field and transverse fields.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this system undergoes a second-order phase transition at zero temperature when the longitudinal field changes sign.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The ground state evolves smoothly to the critical point in the thermodynamic limit but exhibits singular behavior for finite systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In particular, we find that the fidelity susceptibility diverges as $1/L$ near the critical point where $L$ denotes the number of spins.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result implies that the adiabatic process fails to be efficient if one tries to drive the system across the critical point using slow driving rates.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we discuss how our results can be generalized to other models exhibiting similar features.

 The CTCLM is based on three key concepts:  1)

 Lipid bilayers is composed of two interdigitated monolayers; 2) Each monolayer contains both enantiomeric forms of each lipid species; 3) Enantiomers have different molecular shapes that lead to differences in packing density within the membrane.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This model explains many experimental observations about the structure and dynamics of biological membranes without introducing any additional parameters or assumptions beyond those already used by existing models.

Rewrite the following paragraph:

 The lattice Boltzmann method (LBM) is an alternative approach for solving the Navier-Stokes equations in fluid dynamics, which has become widely used due to its advantages over traditional numerical methods such as finite difference and finite element approaches.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In this work we present a new LBM scheme that can been applied to high-speed compressible flows with high Reynolds number by using multiple relaxation times (MRT).

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The MRT-LBM solves the discrete velocity model (DVM), where each distribution function represents one component for the macroscopic variables at different velocities on a regular grid.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use a D2Q9 DVM to solve the two-dimensional incompressible flow problems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 To validate our proposed algorithm, several benchmark tests were performed including lid-driven cavity flow, Couette flow, Poiseuille flow, Taylor-Green vortex flow, and shock wave propagation through a channel.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Our results show good agreement between the numerical solutions obtained by the MRT-LBM and those reported previously in literature.

 We present an analysis on the nonlocal phenomenology in magnetohydrodynamic (MHD) turbulence with strong magnetic field anisotropy, which is relevant to solar wind and space plasmas.

 We present the results from an analysis to determine rates, masses, spins, and luminosities for intermediate mass ratio inspiral (IMRI) events detectable with advanced gravitational wave detectors such as Advanced LIGO.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We use Monte Carlo simulations to generate IMRIs for galactic binaries that are consistent with current observations of binary pulsars and X-ray binaries.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The simulated systems evolve through three phases: detached phase, Roche lobe overflow phase, and common envelope phase.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In our simulation we assume that all stars have solar metallicity and initial spin periods of 10 days.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 With each system generated, we calculate its signal-to-noise ratio using the stationary phase approximation.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We find that there will be about one event per year within 100 Mpc with signal-to-noise ratios greater than 8.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This is comparable with the rate expected for double neutron star mergers.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 However, unlike double neutron star mergers which occur at high redshifts, most IMRI events should be detected nearby.

 We study the distribution around the largest fragment in a fragmentation process, which is an important quantity for understanding how to optimize data transmission over networks and storage systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 We show that this distribution can be approximated by a power law with exponent 1 + 1/(2 - p), where p is the probability that two fragments merge into one when they are adjacent on disk (the so-called "mergeability parameter").

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 This result explains why previous studies have found different exponents depending on whether or not merging was allowed.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 The approximation also allows us to derive closed-form expressions for other quantities such as the mean size of the largest fragment and its variance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Finally, we use our results to explain some recent experimental findings on file sizes in peer-to-peer systems.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 In many applications involving data transmission over networks and distributed storage systems, it is useful to understand how large the largest fragment will become during the course of the system's evolution.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 For example, if a network node has to transmit a certain amount of information within a given time limit, then knowing what fraction of the total data needs to get transmitted at any point in time may help improve performance.

Rewrite the following paragraph:
 Similarly, in distributed storage systems, knowing the expected size of the largest fragment will determine how much space each node should reserve for storing replicas.
